    BAMLSS Families

    families.Rmd

    Overview

    Family objects are important building blocks in the design of BAMLSS models. They specify the distribution by collecting functions of the density, respective log-likelihood, first-order derivatives of the log-likelihood w.r.t. predictors, and (optionally) second-order derivatives of the log-likelihood w.r.t. predictors.

    How to build a BAMLSS family

    Available families

    There are some families implemented:

    x <- scan("../R/families.R", what = character(0))
x[grep("^\\w*_bamlss", x)]

    Continuous response

    • gaussian_bamlss

    Positive continuous response

    • gpareto_bamlss
    • weibull_bamlss
    • gamma_bamlss
    • lognormal_bamlss

    Censored continuous responses

    • cnorm_bamlss

    Interval responses

    • beta_bamlss

    Discrete responses

    • binomial_bamlss
    • mlt_bamlss

    Count data responses

    • poisson_bamlss
    • negbin_bamlss

    Multivariate responses

    • bivnorm_bamlss
    • mvnorm_bamlss

    Others

    Umlauf, Nikolaus, Nadja Klein, Achim Zeileis, and Thorsten Simon. 2018. Bamlss: Bayesian Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape (and Beyond). http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=bamlss.
